newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down on fund, local selling.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down on fund, local selling.

text.p: WCE canola traded down on fund and local selling, traders said.

"Funds sold 1,500 to 2,000 July, locals sold 1,000 November to crushers and bought July and August. Commercials bought July at the close," a trader said. July WCE futures crush margin rose to -2.77 Thursday from -4.21 Wednesday. Aug-Nov spread at $35.50, July-Aug $1.90. Volume was 5,901 lots, or 118,020 tonnes, with 156 hedge lots.
"Old crop needs to be down US$30 a tonne and new crop has to be down another US$15 a tonne to be competitive in Europe," a canola trader said.
Japan bought up to 2,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
July canola fell $2.90 to $414.60, November down $0.50 to $384.50. November flax rose $1.30 to $319.90 with UGG buying.
July feed wheat fell $0.60 to $158.70 on late hedge selling, October fell $0.60 to $161.10 as commercials bought. Locals bought July-Oct at $2.40, May-July $2. Volume was 156.
July western barley up $0.20 to $136.20, December up $0.10 to $137.60 on commercial trade. Volume was 185 lots.
PCTS bought 75 and Gallie Grain bought 25 October feed peas unchanged at US$191.50. UGG bought 5 October oats down US$1.50 at US$117.50, LFG bought 10 December down US$1 at US$119.
(All prices in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats, peas).
